intro: Rhexia recurva, commonly known as the slenderleaf stellaria, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other flowering plants such as willows and evening primroses. The plant features delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, often growing in opposite pairs along the stem. Rhexia recurva thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along stream banks.
